definition: words still ringing in one's ears (idiom)
words/speech/to say/to talk
as if/(just) like/just as/still/yet
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)
ear/handle (archaeology)/and that is all (Classical Chinese)

sentences.english: The mild criticisms of Singapore by Guangzhou mayor Lin Shusen some months ago are still fresh in my mind.
sentences.chinese: 广州市长林树森几个月前对新加坡的微词言犹在耳。

sentences.english: Mind, passage of time, still ringing in our ears.
sentences.chinese: 物换星移，时过境迁，言犹在耳。

definition: lit. so loud that even the deaf can hear (idiom); rousing even the apathetic
lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
(idiom) to have one's words turn out to be (tragically) prophetic
to pledge/to promise/oath/vow
to raise the same topic
bold, visionary words
see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
vivid in one's mind (idiom)
joking matter/to go back on one's words
things change with the passage of time (idiom)
The issue is in the past, and the situation has changed (idiom)./It is water under the bridge.
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
to abide by/to keep (promises etc)
obstinately clinging to one's course (idiom)/willful/one's own way/dogmatic
the past is dead (idiom)
oath/vow/to swear/to pledge
